title: Follow live: Knicks, Pacers battling in tightly contested Game 4
author: ESPN Staff

title: WNBA can't verify hateful comments toward Reese
description: The WNBA said it was unable to substantiate allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed toward Angel Reese during a game against the Fever.
author: Michael Voepel

title: Man Utd meet Wolves terms for £62.5m Cunha deal
description: Manchester United meet the terms of Matheus Cunha's £62.5m release clause and expect to complete the transfer of the Wolves forward quickly.

title: 'Football is a source of comradeship' - Slot grateful for support
description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot thanks "the wider football community" for its support as he is named manager of the year and Premier League manager of the year at the LMA awards.

title: 'I've not been feeling great' - Raducanu battles illness to set up Swiatek clash
description: Emma Raducanu overcame a lengthy medical time-out during a gutsy three-set first-round victory at the French Open to set up a blockbuster meeting with four-time champion Iga Swiatek.

title: Villa make official complaint to PGMOL after referee howler costs them CL
description: Aston Villa have made an official complaint to the PGMOL over the selection of referee Thomas Bramall for their Premier League final-day match against Man Utd, which Champions League-chasing Villa lost after having a goal controversially ruled out.

title: Paige Bueckers gets road ovation in Connecticut homecoming, scores career-high 21 points to lead Wings past Sun
description: The win is the first of the season for the wings and the first of Bueckers' WNBA career.
author: Jason Owens

title: Pérez, Flaherty and Greene power AL-leading Tigers to a 3-1 win over the Giants
description: Wenceel Pérez homered in his first at-bat in his season debut, Jack Flaherty worked six scoreless innings and Riley Greene had three hits and two RBIs as the American League-leading Detroit Tigers beat the San Francisco Giants 3-1 on Tuesday night. Pérez, who had missed the entire season due to a lower back injury, hit a 2-0 pitch 351 feet to right field in the second inning for his first homer since Aug. 7.
author: DAVE HOGG
